Reviews.Review Text: I bought this particular waffle iron recently because I had the same one many years ago and it worked perfectly. But this new one I bought doesn't work as well because the plates pop out. I've seen other reviews complaining about this. The clips don't hold the plates in securely enough. When you insert the bottom plate in, the heating control mechanism inside pushes it up. The inside mechanism is designed with springs to push down when you insert the bottom plate, but apparently the springs are too strong and they push the plate back up out of the clip. So when a waffle is ready to be removed, I have to hold the plates in with potholders so that the plates separate from the waffle. I'm thinking of returning it because I've seen other reviews saying that the plates pop out, but I'm guessing this would be a problem with any replacement that I would receive. Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
Reviews.Review Text:
I purchased this in “Like New” condition but even if it was in brand new condition I cannot recommend this product. The plates are not non-stick like the listing claims. Cooking waffles is such a hassle (the lid is heavy and the handle to lift the lid is slippery and small, the clips holding the cooking plates will unclip in the middle of cooking which is a safety hazard) that I cannot recommend this product.

Also like other reviews have stated, it’s VERY unstable. The “feet” on the unit (if you can even call little stubs feet) do not have rubber on them or anything. Trying to lift the heavy lid when cooking and it’s very hot is near impossible, the black handle on the top slips every time and will either push the unit backwards or it will start to open and then slip crashing back down.

Also the lid never seemed stable. It just would lean back precariously like it was on the brink of crashing backwards if given the slightest push.

I like the fact that the plates are removable, however, the “clips” that are meant to hold the plates in place DO NOT WORK. I had to physically pull the clips for the top and the bottom down because they wouldn’t hold the cooking plates in place. Terrible design choice, especially if you’re cooking and it’s around 400* and the clip decides to pop off. Complete safety hazard.

Decided to return this unit and instead purchased a Cuisinart panini grill with removable plates. Have used it already and it’s a night and day difference. If buying a small sandwich grill, it’s important to get a unit with removable plates, otherwise it’s a pain to clean. The plates on the Cuisinart lock securely in place and are a breeze to take out. The non-stick feature works great instantly and when hand washing the plates, they clean in SECONDS. The quality is literally NIGHT and DAY. Don’t waste your money on the Black and Decker as you won’t be happy with it and you could possibly get hurt. I would recommend getting the Cuisinart instead. It’s a little bit more expensive but it’s worth it in the end.

Hope this helps anyone looking for a reliable indoor grill.
